snippet: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki has come under fire for measures that some lawmakers and political opponents see as an attempt to monopolize power ahead of provincial elections.
abstract: Political crisis facing Shiite-led government of Iraq's Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki appears to escalate, as more political rivals call for his resignation and for early elections; Maliki has come under fire for measures that some lawmakers and political opponents see as an attempt to monopolize power ahead of provincial elections.

byline.original: By DURAID ADNAN and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Duraid Adnan reported from Baghdad, and Christine Hauser from New York.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki has come under fire for measures that some lawmakers and political opponents see as an attempt to monopolize power ahead of provincial elections.

headline.seo: Iraqi Prime Minister Faces More Calls for Resignation
headline.main: Iraqi Prime Minister Faces More Calls for Resignation
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Prime Minister Faces More Calls for Resignation
